description:
You can't catch fish if you don't go fishing, and you can't make friends if you don't at least try.

Which is how relationship-challenged student Yuki finds himself on a fishing trip to a tiny island with three other boys he barely knows. Well, two other boys and Haru, who claims that he's an alien. Not that constantly stewing Natsuki or mysterious Akira are any more likely as prospects for good companionship.

But there's something about fishing that makes it unlike any other pastime, and maybe that quiet sense of companionship and hopeful expectation is just what Yuki needs to start charting the unfamiliar waters of personal connections. Or maybe it will turn out that Haru's right and they're going to have to save the entire planet.

There are lots of different kinds of fish stories, from the "ones that got away" to the "best catches ever," but whichever way the currents of life take them, for four young men, this trip may turn out to be the biggest whopper ever!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

name.native: アキラ・アガルカール・山田

node.description:
Freelance director originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

Known for having directed shows such as [Mononoke](https://anilist.co/anime/2246/), [Welcome to Irabu's Office](https://anilist.co/anime/6774/) and [Tsuritama](https://anilist.co/anime/12883/) among others. He was also set to serve as an assistant director to [Mamoru Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/) on [Howl's Moving Castle](https://anilist.co/anime/431/), but this was later scrapped due to creative differences with [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/), who ended up directing the film himself.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ukiatsuya) | [Website](http://www.ukix.org/nl/) | [Tumblr](https://ukix.tumblr.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ukix/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宇木敦哉)

After graduation, Uki was awarded at the Kodansha Afternoon Shiki Contest in 2002 and 2003. His manga [Amon Game](https://anilist.co/manga/46759/Amon-Game/) received the Shiki Grand Prize in 2005. His handwritten animation style and sense of design and colour has let to him being highly regarded and prominent among new animation directors.

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

- Masaki Kurihara: soprano recorder, melodica, crumhorn, etc. 
- Yoshiyuki Kawaguchi: alto recorder, bodhran, saxophone, etc.

- Takero Sekizima: great bass recorder, tuba, jew's harp, etc.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kuricorder) | [Official Website](http://www.kuricorder.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kuricorder) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/kuricorderquartet)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/193795545)

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

__[Website](https://www.fujifabric.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fujifabric_info) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/fujifabric) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/fujifabricSMEJ)__

__Formed:__ 2000

__Biography:__
Fujifabric was initially formed by Masahiko Shimura in the early 2000s and consisted of five members. They released their first mini album in 2002 titled _A la carte_, and later made their major debut with "Sakura no Kisetsu" through record label EMI Music Japan (known as Toshiba EMI at the time) on April 14, 2004. 

After being active for 9 years, the band would go through a sudden change when Shimura died at the age of 29 on December 24, 2009. At the time the band consisted of four members, Masahiko Shimura, a vocalist and guitarist, Souichirou Yamauchi, a guitarist, Daisuke Kanazawa, a keyboardist, and Shinichi Katou, a bassist. The remaining members decided to continue band activities as a three-piece band, with Souichirou taking over as the vocalist.

__Members:__
- Souichirou Yamauchi (山内総一郎) – vocalist and guitarist
- [Daisuke Kanazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/209456/Daisuke-Kanazawa) (金澤ダイスケ) – keyboardist, lyricist and composer
- Shinichi Katou (加藤慎一) – bassist

__[Profile (Sony Music)](https://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/sayonaraponytail/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sayopony)__

A mysterious trio of girls, who remain anonymous and are only identified by drawings made by their lead singer. They are proclaiming to be huge anime fans.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzumevachi)

Freelancer formerly affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

Close friends with [Rie Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/107664/), and the two often work together.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/42231474)

The founder and representative director of [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/). Originally a producer for [Fuji TV](https://anilist.co/studio/169/), where he produced numerous anime for the Noitamina programming block.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kimu777)

Makoto Kimura is an animation producer originally from Fuji TV Noitamina. He then moved to [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/Twin-Engine) and later then to Studio [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA) where he was the Director of Planning Department. In April 2024, he left MAPPA and formed BLUE RIGHTS Co. Ltd.

_Note: Not to be confused with the background artist [Makoto Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/182523/)._

[Website](http://qbo.sakura.ne.jp/masahiko/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/macha_mkun) | [Flickr](https://www.flickr.com/people/39493978@N08/)

In recent years he has also been working as still photographer.

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [Duel Masters character designer](https://anilist.co/staff/185645/) or the [studio coordinator](https://anilist.co/staff/172956/)._
